item.title:
RT by @carolecadwalla: #SLAPP: In her judgement, Mrs Justice Steyn said it was "neither fair nor apt" to describe the lawsuit @carolecadwalla faced as a SLAPP.
As co-chairs of the UK Anti-SLAPP Coalition, we disagree with that assessment.
Read why in our @thebarcouncil blog: https://www.barcouncil.org.uk/resource/slapp-a-question-of-definition.html
item.dc:creator: @jessicanimhain
item.description:
#SLAPP: In her judgement, Mrs Justice Steyn said it was "neither fair nor apt" to describe the lawsuit @carolecadwalla faced as a SLAPP.

As co-chairs of the UK Anti-SLAPP Coalition, we disagree with that assessment.

Read why in our @thebarcouncil blog: barcouncil.org.uk/resource/s‚Ä¶

nitter.42l.fr/IndexCensorship/status/1541807831594188801#m

item.title:
RT by @carolecadwalla: The co-chairs of the UK Anti-SLAPP Coalition, including Index's @jessicanimhain, explain why they continue to categorise the lawsuit @carolecadwalla faced as a #SLAPP.
"We reaffirmed that categorisation in Jan '22 & we stand behind it now"
https://www.barcouncil.org.uk/resource/slapp-a-question-of-definition.html @thebarcouncil
item.dc:creator: @IndexCensorship

item.title:
RT by @carolecadwalla: üö® NEW: A controversial #BillOfRights proposed in UK has alarmed human rights defenders.
But Britons are showing resilience in the face of oppression, reports @sylviamuia for @allthecitizens @theelephantinfo.
Support our #BillWatch campaign: https://crowdfunder.co.uk/p/bill-watch #Glastonbury
item.dc:creator: @allthecitizens

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: Thank you as ever to my legal team & everyone who contributed to my crowdfunders.
I couldn‚Äôt face court 13 again. Instead, I listened to UN special rapporteur on freedom of expression describe how the global attack on journalists & journalism is happening at an ecosystem level.
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: There‚Äôs rather bigger legal news today but Banks has won permission to appeal on a single ground about continued publication after a change in circumstances.
Aka whether a rich man is afforded the right in law to force publications to re-write history.
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2022/jun/24/arron-banks-permission-to-appeal-judge-carole-cadwalladr
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
There‚Äôs rather bigger legal news today but Banks has won permission to appeal on a single ground about continued publication after a change in circumstances.

Aka whether a rich man is afforded the right in law to force publications to re-write history.

theguardian.com/uk-news/2022‚Ä¶

item.title:
Arron Banks lost his defamation claim against me. But today, his legal team are back in the Royal Courts of Justice seeking permission to appeal.
This is our response.
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
Arron Banks lost his defamation claim against me. But today, his legal team are back in the Royal Courts of Justice seeking permission to appeal.

This is our response.

item.title: RT by @carolecadwalla: For those of us combatting ‚Äòlawfare‚Äô, today‚Äôs judgement in the Cadwalladr case is very important. Libel law in England‚Äôs been too heavily loaded against defendants. We need to protect public interest journalism and investigations properly, like the US does, with new legislation.
item.dc:creator: @Chris_D_Steele
item.description: For those of us combatting ‚Äòlawfare‚Äô, today‚Äôs judgement in the Cadwalladr case is very important. Libel law in England‚Äôs been too heavily loaded against defendants. We need to protect public interest journalism and investigations properly, like the US does, with new legislation.

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: THE END
(I hope.) Banks may still appeal. But he can only appeal on the legal argument. Not the facts. Facts are facts. And we have them now.
I have so many people to thank individually but for now, thank you, thank you, thank youüôèüôèüôè 14/
https://www.judiciary.uk/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/Banks-v-Cadwalladr-130622-Judgment.pdf
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
THE END

(I hope.) Banks may still appeal. But he can only appeal on the legal argument. Not the facts. Facts are facts. And we have them now.

I have so many people to thank individually but for now, thank you, thank you, thank youüôèüôèüôè
14/

judiciary.uk/wp-content/uplo‚Ä¶

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: One day, I believe people in Britain will want to know what actually happened in 2016.
That day is not yet here. But it will eventually come. And when it does, this 117-page forensic examination of the facts will form part of the historic record.
https://www.judiciary.uk/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/Banks-v-Cadwalladr-130622-Judgment.pdf 13/
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
One day, I believe people in Britain will want to know what actually happened in 2016.

judiciary.uk/wp-content/uplo‚Ä¶
13/

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: Most people don't have this option. That includes news orgs & public bodies. It's why we DESPERATELY need a change in the law.
This wasn't Banks's first libel case. His previous target was the Electoral Commission. It settled. These words were deleted from the public record. 12/
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
Most people don't have this option. That includes news orgs & public bodies. It's why we DESPERATELY need a change in the law.

This wasn't Banks's first libel case. His previous target was the Electoral Commission. It settled. These words were deleted from the public record.
12/

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: I'm a mess, my life is a mess, but black is not white.
And that's why this victory belongs to the 28,887 people who backed me & stood alongside me.
I stole these words about holding the line from the great @mariaressa. Because they're true. And in some small way, we did. 11/
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
I'm a mess, my life is a mess, but black is not white.

And that's why this victory belongs to the 28,887 people who backed me & stood alongside me.

I stole these words about holding the line from the great @mariaressa. Because they're true. And in some small way, we did.
11/

item.title: R to @carolecadwalla: I walked into court facing a ¬£500k shortfall if I lost & the destruction of my journalistic reputation. 10/
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
I walked into court facing a ¬£500k shortfall if I lost & the destruction of my journalistic reputation.
10/

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: I didn't fight this case to advance the legal defence of public interest reporting. Although it has done that.
Nor to put these matters about Russia & Brexit on public record. Though it's done that too.
I just couldn't retract what I knew to be fact. Black is not white. 9/
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
I didn't fight this case to advance the legal defence of public interest reporting. Although it has done that.

Nor to put these matters about Russia & Brexit on public record. Though it's done that too.

I just couldn't retract what I knew to be fact. Black is not white.
9/

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: On the morning of trial, Banks & I were still trying to reach a settlement.
His demands included an undertaking to retract & never repeat the words from the TED talk: that he lied about his covert relationship with the Russian govt.
And I just couldn't do it. 8/
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
On the morning of trial, Banks & I were still trying to reach a settlement.

His demands included an undertaking to retract & never repeat the words from the TED talk: that he lied about his covert relationship with the Russian govt.

And I just couldn't do it.
8/

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: There's more.
Mrs Justice Steyn found Banks's claim he received a document entitled "Russian gold sector consolidation play" from a UK associate not a Russian oligarch was "not credible".
Also "not credible" was the explanation for why Wigmore said he had been in Moscow. 7/
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
There's more.

Mrs Justice Steyn found Banks's claim he received a document entitled "Russian gold sector consolidation play" from a UK associate not a Russian oligarch was "not credible".

Also "not credible" was the explanation for why Wigmore said he had been in Moscow.
7/

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: Mrs Justice Steyn said "Ms Cadwalladr also had reasonable grounds for believing":
"Mr Banks shared information with Russian officials"
"Mr Banks had been offered sweetheart deals"
He "used terminology suggestive of a r'ship in which he could visit the ambassador with ease" 6/
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
Mrs Justice Steyn said "Ms Cadwalladr also had reasonable grounds for believing":

"Mr Banks shared information with Russian officials"

"Mr Banks had been offered sweetheart deals"

He "used terminology suggestive of a r'ship in which he could visit the ambassador with ease"
6/

item.title:
R to @carolecadwalla: In her judgment, Mrs Justice Steyn says:
* Arron Banks had "at least four meetings" with Russian officials
* It would be "wrong to expect a journalist from identifying such an inaccurate statement..as a lie"
* The 4 meetings were "probably not the full extent" of it 5/
item.dc:creator: @carolecadwalla
item.description:
In her judgment, Mrs Justice Steyn says:

* Arron Banks had "at least four meetings" with Russian officials

* It would be "wrong to expect a journalist from identifying such an inaccurate statement..as a lie"

* The 4 meetings were "probably not the full extent" of it
5/
